only.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: not more than a particular number, age etc
only.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Naomi was only 17 when she got married.
There are only a few cars on the island.
only.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to say that something or someone is not very important, serious etc
only.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: It’s an interesting job, but it’s only temporary.
They’re only small cuts, nothing life-threatening.
only.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: nothing or no one except a particular person or thing
only.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Only the president can authorize a nuclear attack.
We use only the best ingredients.
The car park is for staff only.
only.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used to say that something happens or is possible in one particular situation or place and no others, or for one particular reason
only.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I’ll tell you, but only if you don’t tell anyone else.
I ate the food, but only because I was starving.
The transfer takes place only when the data is complete.
only.translation[0].definitions[3].note_: Only usually comes between the subject and the main verb
Only usually comes between an auxiliary verb and a main verb
I can only see two people
When you want to emphasize what you are saying, you sometimes use only at the beginning of a sentence, and put the auxiliary verb before the subject
Only later did  I understand what she meant
Only by improving social and economic conditions can good health be achieved
only.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: no earlier than a particular time
only.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Only then did she tell him about the attack.
only then did/would/could etc somebody do something
only.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: used to say that there is one person, thing, or group in a particular situation and no others
only.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I was the only woman there.
I was the only one who disagreed.
Cutting costs is the only solution.
She’s the only person for this job.
only.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: used like ‘but’ to give the reason why something is not possible
only.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: I’d offer to help, only I’m really busy just now.
